parameters.subject: Welcome Aboard!

parameters.html:
Thank you for your application—on this occasion we won’t be progressing to interview.
 
Your Organisation

Application Outcome

Dear {{ $json.firstName }},

Thank you for your application and for the time and care you put into it.

After careful consideration, we won’t be progressing your application to the next stage on this occasion.

Thank you again for your interest.

With warm wishes,
Recruitment Team

This message was sent by our organisation. If you received it by mistake, please disregard.

parameters.html:
Thank you again for your application—please choose an interview time that suits you.
 
Your Organisation

Invitation to Interview

Dear {{ $json.firstName }},

Thank you again for your application. We’re pleased to invite you to an interview.

Please choose a time that suits you using the link below. The interview will last around 30–45 minutes.

Choose your interview slot
  • You’ll receive a confirmation and calendar invite after booking.
  • If you can’t find a suitable time, just reply to this email and we’ll help.
  • If you need any adjustments for the interview, let us know.
If the button doesn’t work, copy and paste this link into your browser:
https://calendar.app.google/R7CoWEu8ioPnaSpm6

We look forward to meeting you.

With warm wishes,
Recruitment Team

This message was sent by our organisation. If you received it by mistake, please disregard.

parameters.content:
In reality, these would run sub-workflows, for better error handling and separation of concerns.

I've combined them here so it's easier for you look through.
Some APIs return an array nested nested in an object for example, meaning we have to use custom code to split into individual items, rather than the built-in n8n node.

parameters.content: To programatically add hyperlinks in Sharepoint lists we need to use the Sharepoint REST API, Microsoft graph won't work.

parameters.html:
Welcome aboard! Here are your onboarding details, key dates, and next steps.
 
Your Organisation

Welcome Aboard!

We’re delighted to confirm your acceptance and share your onboarding steps.

Dear {{ $json.firstName }},

Congratulations and welcome to the team! You’ll be joining us as {{ $json.role || 'your new role' }}, starting {{ $json.startDate || 'your start date' }}.

Below are your key details and the actions to complete before day one.

Start
{{ $json.startDate || 'TBD' }}{{ $json.startTime ? (' — ' + $json.startTime) : '' }}
Location
{{ $json.location || 'We’ll confirm your reporting location' }}
Manager
{{ $json.managerName || 'Your manager' }}{{ $json.managerEmail ? (' — ' + $json.managerEmail) : '' }}
What to bring
{{ $json.docsToBring || 'Photo ID, right-to-work docs, bank details, emergency contact' }}
Start your onboarding
Your next steps
  • Complete the onboarding form (personal details, emergency contact).
  • Upload any required documents (ID / right-to-work / certifications).
  • Review and sign policies/agreements in the portal.
  • Set up your accounts using the invitations we’ll send (email, chat, tools).
  • Check your first-day schedule and meeting invites.
If the button doesn’t work, copy and paste this link into your browser:
{{ $json.onboardingLink || 'https://example.com/onboarding' }}

We’re excited to have you with us, {{ $json.firstName }}.

If you have any questions, reply to this email or contact {{ $json.hrEmail || 'people@example.com' }} .

With warm wishes,
People & Operations Team

This message was sent by our organisation. If you received it by mistake, please disregard.

parameters.subject: Fully Accept Worflow Error: Tried to Create Duplicate User in Entra
parameters.message:
=Fully Accept Worflow Error:

{{ $json['Volunteer First Name'] }}.{{ $json['Volunteer Last Name'] }}@example.com already exists in Entra. Please decide on the best unique User Pricinple Name (email address) and manually create the user, with their account set as deactivated.

nodes.name: Give time for a cancel request

options.systemMessage:
=You are an error handler agent. You have 3 tools available to you. Please analyse the error and decide on what should be queried and done to resolve it.

1. Use the Microsoft Graph GET request tool to figure out the root cause. If you don't know the URL you need, use the Microsoft Learn MCP client tool to figure out how to construct the correct URL.
If you could fix the issue:
2.1 Send an informational email about what you did.
If you couldn't fix the issue:
2.2 Send an email detailing the issue and reccomended actions with reasoning and proof for your reccomendations. Make sure to include what succesfully happened in the errored workflow and what didn't happen because of the error, including downstream from the error.

Note that only 1 email should be sent.
Please make the emails graphically interesting, and easy to understand, use diagrams where relevant. But they should always bisplay properly in email clients.

Finally, be efficient with token usage, we are on a budget, so no need to repeat steps if you are already confident etc etc.

parameters.toolDescription: Makes an HTTP GET request to Microsfot Graph and returns the response data

parameters.content:
## AI Error Handler Flow
### In reality it's the specific Error trigger node rather than 
### the webhook that would be used in a separate generic workflow.
### I wanted to include everything in one blueprint for this demo.
### Microsoft Graph Tool (MCP Docs + Request Node) - duplicate for other APIs as desired.

parameters.toolDescription: Send a email. The body must be HTML. Note that you can't receive responses from the email so please don't say in your message that one can respond.

parameters.content: n8n runs branches top to bottom, and in our case the order of operations does matter: We always want the applicant to be emailed, we don't want a workflow-stopping error to prevent that. Though with proper error handling an error is unlikely to stop the whole flow.
